headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Hearing Underway On Motions To Disqualify Fani Willis In Trump Case. Aired 1:30-2p ET

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: As it relates to, again, from your -- from your bank records that you're aware of, there'll be -- there'll be no cash deposits, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I didn't say that.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Are there cash deposits which lineup with the money that you have allegedly received from Ms. Willis to, quote, "pay you back" for her part of the trips?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So here's the thing. In my bank records, you will see cash deposits. You will see check deposits. I can't say that you look through the bank records and you won't see cash deposits because I have two sources of income, sir.Income comes from my private practice, my firm, and income comes from the contract here with Fulton County. During the course of private practice, occasionally, I will have occasion to deposit cash into my account.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: And in preparation for this hearing and your testimony, did you go through your bank records to find out if you could locate any cash deposits that would corroborate your -- your testimony?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir. I didn't go through my bank records at all.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now -- so what you would do, the money that you've received, of course, the money that you receive from your work for Fulton County, that's public funds, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir. It's private funds. My public funds --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Hey, you do work for Fulton County, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Tell me what the definition of a public fund is?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: A public fund would be your funds -- as not a fund, but funds, money public money, as in money from taxpayers by the Fulton County or the state of Georgia, pay you to do the work that you're doing here in this case. Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: One of the other, I'm certain.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You know, we've wanted --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I don't know. It's one. No, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now, those -- you would take those public funds and those public funds would then you deposit in your account and they were then used to pay for the -- on the credit cards for the trips that you would take with Ms. Willis, correct?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I object to the question, so far as the characterization of public funds, The witnesses testified to that. And I believe there hasn't been any evidence to that --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Once his patroness, the weight on it, the point of it is, is that you guys --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: JUDGE SCOTT MCAFEE, FULTON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT
utterances.sentences: Mr. Gallen rephrase now.

utterances.speaker: GALLEN
utterances.sentences: Let's break it down. You got money from Fulton County for the work that you do here, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You would send in invoices. They would pay you money, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Those months that -- the private money, that money was money from either the citizens of Fulton County or from the state of Georgia, correct? That's what I mean by public funds. Agreed?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I guess I'm having trouble with the notion that the citizens of Fulton County had paid me any funds. I'm not certain that funding source, I can tell you that either the state of Georgia or Fulton County has written me a check.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: So that would be those two entities are public entities, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: That would be public funds, right? Right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: And that those public funds are from the same source that you would then used to pay out on your on your -- on your expenses for the trips that you took Ms. Willis on, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir. As a testified to moments ago, I have income coming in from my law firm. I also have income coming in from the funds that we're here discussing now from either the state of Georgia or Fulton County and/or both. I'm not certain what it is.So to say so to say -- (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So to say --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So to say that I'm paying a credit card statement with funds coming from Fulton County or the state of Georgia would -- would not be inaccurate statement because the funds could very well come from my private practice.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: What percentage of your income in 2022 came from money where you're working on this case or from your partners working for the Fulton County office?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: In 2022, I would -- I would say 50/50.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You think 50/50 in 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: What about 2023?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Probably 60/40.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: The money that would be in those accounts, at least 60 percent of those, in your view, would be the public funds, that those monies were then used to pay for the expenses that you had incurred for the trips that you took Ms. Willis on, the cruises, the Napa Valleys, the Bahamas, correct? Right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. And now, what you -- what you did is that, when you -- when you signed on in the November 1st of 2021, that's when you signed on to be counsel for the anti-corruption matters, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now as you know, in your engagement letter, it doesn't say that you're signing on in -- your scope of work is to work on the Trump special grand jury investigation, does it? WADE

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: It says that you're signing on to work on anti-corruption -- the anti-corruption unit matters, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Matters. And with a with a pleural, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: So in your contract, there is no specific reference to any specific case, isn't that right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, but you didn't sign on for the duration, there was a period -- you have a contract and then it would then expire, then you would have a new contract, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now, of course, the extension that you received, the first one was in November of 2021 and then you filed -- or excuse me, there was a renewal in November the 15th of 2022, is that right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Sounds right.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Now that was right after you got re-upped by Ms. Willis? Right after you took Ms. Willis to Aruba? Isn't that right? On that November the 1st, 2022 trip to Aruba and through November the 4th, 2022? Correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: What is re-upped mean?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Re-upped means that you came back, your contract was up, and then on November the 15th, you and Ms. Willis signed a new contract for you, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, when you were in -- taking her to Aruba and on the cruises and, let's see, the resort there, did you discuss your re- upping of the signing an extension on your contract?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No sir.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: But you make an excellent point. I'm glad you pointed that out.So the trip to Aruba -- the contract was not in existence then.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You're saying -- so you're saying that you were not --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Under contract. GILLEN

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You didn't?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: So when that expired, that was it? So then you're saying that after the Aruba trip, you get re-upped with a new contract, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I signed a new contract, yes.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now was there any modifications on that contract? Did you get an extension on the cap that you were limited on the first one? Were there any modifications at all, Mr. Willis -- excuse me. I've done that again. I apologize.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've been called worse.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've been called worse.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Were there any modifications on that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Do you have the contracts in front of you where you could --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I don't have it in front of me, but I think that --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: That's why there was a conversation on your extension?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, the caps.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now did Ms. Willis -- excuse me. Did Ms. Willis review your invoices with you when you would submit them? WADE

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Did anyone ever question whether or not you worked 24 hours in one day and billed 24 hours in one day?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've never worked 24 hours in one day and bill 24 hours in one day.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: And I'm glad you asked me that question because I'd like the opportunity to talk about that.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I think you should. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So if you look at that invoice where it says 24 hours in one day, it actually doesn't say one day. If you look at the top of the invoice, it says date completed.The date that's reflected on that invoice reflects the date that the work was completed. It doesn't say when it started. It just says this is the date that is completed. So if you go through the invoice, it's probably around the first five or six, you'll see that that's the billing format. I would bill only after that particular task has been completed. That's why you see a 24-hour period with the one day there. I kind of wish some of the experts who had opined on that had called me and asked me the question. But there was never a billing of 24 hours in one day. Now, probably around the sixth or seventh invoice, you see the format change. I started using a range so that it got less confusing, right?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I'm confused. So maybe you can correct it.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: In Exhibit 14, you've got you've got down a specific day.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Uh-huh.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Prepared cases for pretrial. November the 5th 2021, 24 hours at $250 an hour, $6,000.Now this wasn't about -- this was not about a range. It was about the work that you did on November 5th.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Go on.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Galen, look at the top of the invoice where it says "date completed." GILLENhave down there and tell the court what you billed for on November the 5th, 2021. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I thought it was already in. I thought --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Again, Mr. Galen, it says "completed date, date completed." The dates that you see here are the dates that work was completed.So on November the 5th, I completed the task of preparing the cases for pretrial. That's the date I completed it. Just read --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It took me --

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Just read, if you would. My question was, read out loud the entry for November the 5th, 2021, and how many hours you billed that day. Just -- just do that for me, if you would.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I can't do that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. I believe he's entitled to answer his question, ask him, it wasn't the question that (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, the question now is to read a certain interest.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Just read into the record, Mr. Wade, on November 5th, 2021, how many hours did you bill the citizens of Fulton County for on that day? Just read it out, please.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I completed the task on November 5th, 2021. And 24 hours was billed at $250.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Now, when you are -- you talked about your relationship with Ms. Willis and your testimony is that it began in 2022. You remember that testimony?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir. Our relationship began --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Your romantic relationship began in 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: That's your testimony?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Now when you were re-upped on this contract, you had a romantic relationship already established with Ms. Willis, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Your re-up on November the 15th, 2022, you had a romantic relationship with Ms. Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I signed the second contract. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to use the words re-up.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: You signed up, re-upped, or whatever you want to call it, your contract on November the 15th, 2022, you had a romantic relationship already existing with Ms. Willis, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I signed the contract, the second contract, yes sir, during the course of romantic relations.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Yes or no, you had a romantic relationship with her at the time that you signed up the extension on November the 15th, 2022, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: The answer to that question is yes.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.Now the -- this was before the special purpose grand jury released any report, isn't that correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Are you asking me if it's before the work was completed or before the special purpose grand jury actually released, publicly released the report --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: When they were two different reports.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Your relationship with this Ms. Willis already existed when the special purpose grand jury released its report, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: At the time the report was released? Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: And --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: But you understand that the report -- the work had been completed prior to the release of the report. You understand that?

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: And your relationship with Ms. Willis, of course, was prior to the indictment in this case, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: Your Honor, if I may just ask my folks over here whether there's something I need to clean up on.That's all the questions, Your Honor, I have. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: GILLEN
utterances.sentences: I said I think we're through.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: -- no, I and ask permission --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: He was going to go further on this and I was going to follow up. And allow him to go first.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: That's what I thought I had.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Let me -- the understanding next time we're going to keep going in order and not skip around the order.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: That's why I brought it up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. All right.Mr. Sadow? STEVE SADOW, DONALD TRUMP'S DEFENSE ATTORNEY: I'm going to try to keep my questions very specific.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And I'm going to also, of course, try not to go back into specific questions that have already been asked, OK?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: When did your relationship with Ms. Willis end?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Can you give us an approximation of -- not by date, but by month?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Summer 2023 -- forgive me, I'm a man. We don't do the date thing. Summer 23, I would say June maybe.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Using the euphemism personal relationship, did you have any personal relationship at all with Ms. Willis after the summer of 2023?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I want to make sure that I'm answering your question. Are you -- because --

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Let mee rephrase, if I might.The way it has been characterized in, for example, the response of the state and I believe in your affidavit, is there is a difference between a personal relationship, any professional relationship, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I'm not talking about a professional relationship. I'm talking about the personal relationship. Have you had a personal relationship at all -- and you know what I mean by that -- after the summer of 2023?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Are you asking me if I had intercourse with the district attorney?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I was trying not to, but I guess if you're going to characterize it as that, the answer would be?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: The answer would be no.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So it's been purely professional since the summer of 2023?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So that's where we're having issues.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: You'll have to explain because I don't know what the issue would be.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, I will explain it to you.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: You say personal. We're very good friends, probably closer than ever because of these attacks. But if you're asking me about specific intercourse, the answer is no.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: How about if I change it from intercourse to romantic?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Wait. If you're asking me if people knew that we were having sex, no, they didn't. SADOWwhether you were romantically involved. You said that it was not a secret?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Oh, it wasn't a secret. It was just private. My mother knew obviously.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Did anyone in the district attorney's office that has worked on this case know that you were dating or had a romantic relationship with District Attorney Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I don't know what they knew.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Well, did you tell anyone?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Do you have any knowledge of whether Ms. Willis revealed it to anyone?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I have no clue.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. So as far as you know, as far as you know, from personal knowledge, no one in the D.A.'s team knew, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. So if it was a legitimate relationship, is there any particular reason why it was kept secret or private?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It wasn't kept secret. Just kept private.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And the purpose for that was.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It's what we chose to do.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I'm asking you why though, not just because you chose. What -- if you're dating someone, why keep it private?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So two reasons. The first one is -- and I want to say this respectfully in the right way. There are some people who are in the public eye who just don't like it, don't wish to be there.I have tried to have lunch or dinner with her publicly, and I can't count the number of people that would approach the table or would accost us as were trying to walk into a restaurant and just have lunch or have a meal. It is not secret. It is private. We don't want the world -- the world asking questions or interrupting that time. So we weren't trying to keep anything secret, Mr. Sadow. It does nothing secret or salacious about having a private life, nothing.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I'm not suggesting that there was. I'm asking the questions. When you went on the various trips that have been outlined by both Mr.Gillan and by Ms. Merchant, did anyone in the district attorney's office know that the two of you were traveling on personal trips together?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: To my knowledge, Mr. Sadow, no.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Again, that was for privacy, according to your testimony?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Privacy, yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Did you and Ms. Willis go to the Hape Ville condo prior to your relationship starting beginning of 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Prior to having physical contact, prior to having intercourse, did we go to the Hape Ville condo?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Again, you keep going to intercourse. I'm trying not to, but fine. The answer to that question would be yes.Did you and Ms. Willis go to the Hape Ville condo prior to what I want to say, November 1st of 29th, 2021?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. And the purpose for going to the Hape Ville condo with Ms. Willis prior to 2021 would have been what? Or prior to November 1st of 2021.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Could have been any number of things. Because at that time --

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: It's what I'm asking you to tell me.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Could have been in a number of things because, at that time, she had a friend living in that condo. Ms. Ruraity (ph) lived in that condo.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. It -- maybe it was my question was poorly worded. Let me try again.Your answer is yes. Prior to November 1st of 2021, you would have gone to the Hape Ville condo and been there with Ms. Willis, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And you would have been there, as you indicated, for many reasons, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Can you give me just list a few of the reasons?Ms. Ruraity (ph) resided there. Went to visit her. Maybe went to talk about a document that I received. (CROSSTALK) SADOW: You would go to the condo to talk about a document that you received?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Any other reasons?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: None come to mind.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: None come to mind?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: And would you say that was frequent? When I say frequent, do you think prior to November 1st of 2021, you were at the condo more than 10 times?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So it'd be less than 10 times?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So if phone records were to reflect that you were making phone calls from the same location as a condo before November 1st of 2021, and it was on multiple occasions, the phone records would be wrong?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: If phone records reflected that? Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: They'd be wrong?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They'd be wrong.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Did you -- where did you live during that time period?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Same place I live now.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Which is not in Hape Ville, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It is not in Hape Ville.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: It is north of Atlanta, the city of Atlanta, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. And any other reasons why you would be in the Hape Ville area on multiple occasions prior to November 1st of 2021?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Let's see, the Porshe experiences there.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: The Porshe experiences there.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So that would've been one. Any other?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. The airport is there.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: The airport in Hape Ville?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir, Delta Airlines is.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Let's see. Restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: You have -- if that's your recollection, that's fine. I'm not asking you to try to remember everything, but if --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Did you discuss your affidavit, filed in connection with the response, with Ms. Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Did you know, a personal knowledge, whether Ms. Willis reviewed your affidavit before it was included with the response?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I have no clue.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: So as far as you know, personal knowledge, Ms. Willis did not know what you said in the affidavit?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I didn't give it to her.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: That's what I said. You have no personal knowledge?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No personal knowledge.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: As far as you know, no one else has told you that she did or didn't?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I hadn't asked anyone.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: The -- we've kind of worked this up a little bit and the numbers could be off. But according to our numbers, $10,000, give or take, would have been reflected on your credit card statements in connection with things potential benefit to Ms. Willis? OK? I want you to just to assume that.Assuming that there was $10,000 that you had on your credit cards, is it your testimony that Ms. Willis paid you back $10,000 in cash? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Object of characterization of the questioning of $10,000 for Ms. Willis' travel. I don't believe them what the numbers, at least the summary that I've been provided by joint travel. Is that right, Mr. Sadow, sorry.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: No, it's not joint travel.But all I'm trying to understand -- I'll rephrase because I don't want to get bogged down on specific numbers. You would have received thousands of dollars in cash from Ms. Willis, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. In the thousands of dollars in cash from Ms. Willis, do you know -- not asking you whether she took it out of her pocketbook or she took it out of a suitcase. I'm saying, do you know the source of the cash?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Just that, out of her pocketbook?

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: You don't know where she obtained the cash?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I didn't ask her.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: The whole time that you -- she was paying you in cash, you never said, hey, why do you have this amount of cash?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Well, Mr. Mr. Sadow, in my practice, people come into my law firm with cash and I never questioned where they got it.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. But we're talking not about people that come into your law firm. We're talking about the district attorney of Fulton County, who I'm assuming receives a paycheck. She doesn't get paid in cash.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So just like you assume, I assume she got it from her paycheck. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. But of course, it's already been -- I'm not going to go back into it. You've not seen any records indicating withdrawals of cash from Ms. Willis at all?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Why would I ask her --

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: All I said is you haven't, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: SADOW
utterances.sentences: OK. Now can you explain why you filed for divorce one day after you were hired by Ms. Willis? You filed on November 2nd of 2021. You're hired on November 1st of 2021. Why the day after?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: You mean one day so -- SADOW

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK I'll answer your question.
